intro: Swainsona adenophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf swainsona, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Swainsona adenophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world for horticultural purposes.
